channel.title: Community Update
channel.description:
We're freaking out over here! It is so exciting to share this news with you!
* You can now Download the Black Mesa Soundtrack, courtesy of our very own Joel Nielsen, at the very generous price of whatever you want! Enjoy and share! * In the near future you'll see our Website, Wiki and Forums all taken down temporarily for renovations. * On September 14th you will see the first release of Black Mesa! This will include our re-envisioning of Half-Life all the way up to Lambda Core. We believe this is a great way to provide a complete-feeling 8-10 hour experience with a solid ending, make our fans happy and help us make the best overall game possible.
We are still working hard on Xen and BMDM, but instead of making you wait we are giving you Black Mesa as soon as it's ready! We're doing our best to help bring the immense vision of this project into reality, and we are very excited for what the future brings!
High-Fives Yo, Carlos Montero - Project Leader

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Good call. We can re-open it when there’s a further update.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
It’s possible they simply don’t have anything noteworthy to say. Besides, it makes a bigger impact when they do say something after months of silence.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
He was serious about getting back on topic, and so am I.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Okay, folks, enough about Gordon’s crowbar (unless you wish to make another thread). Let’s keep this to the community update only.

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: CPU
item.description:
Tuskin38:

You’re the one who is confusing them.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass

That is exactly what he is describing.

His statement was “Gordon’s crowbar has no mass.”
That’s why I said “I think you’re confusing mass with gravity.”

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: Tuskin38
item.description:
CPU:

I think you’re confusing mass with gravity.

You’re the one who is confusing them.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass

Mass is a property of a physical body which determines the body’s resistance to being accelerated by a force.

That is exactly what he is describing.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
And this is why Gordon started to kill aliens, those damn complicated physics made him mad. Screw theoretical, gotta find out in practice if their skulls can withstand the impact of a crowbar.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: CPU
item.description:
.RK:

But it makes sense, because Gordon’s crowbar has no mass.

I think you’re confusing mass with gravity.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: Swaggless
item.description:
Merode:

Maybe in other dimensions with different physics…

Exactly. Force = Mass X Acceleration. If mass=0, no matter how great the acceleration, the force would be 0.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: Merode
item.description:
.RK:
  • An object with no mass can still cause injuries just through swing force. Crowbar works as we see in games.

Maybe in other dimensions with different physics…

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: sourcegamer101
item.description:
.RK:

But it makes sense, because Gordon’s crowbar has no mass.

The argument:

  • Gordon can swing his crowbar with no difficulty. This can imply that minimal energy is needed to do so. Less mass = less energy needed.
  • An object without mass is not affected by gravity. Therefore, the crowbar would remain floating, as the above posts suggest.
  • An object with no mass can still cause injuries just through swing force. Crowbar works as we see in games.

That’s why is Freeman’s favorite weapon :retard:

Wow…

It all makes sense now… :freeman:

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: RK1
item.description:
But it makes sense, because Gordon’s crowbar has no mass.

The argument:

  • Gordon can swing his crowbar with no difficulty. This can imply that minimal energy is needed to do so. Less mass = less energy needed.
  • An object without mass is not affected by gravity. Therefore, the crowbar would remain floating, as the above posts suggest.
  • An object with no mass can still cause injuries just through swing force. Crowbar works as we see in games.

That’s why is Freeman’s favorite weapon :retard:

Read full topic

item.title: Community Update
item.dc:creator: RAMacindux
item.description:
Dotard:

Xen will be available and jumping into the portal will teleport us there, but since people complained about platforming in a first person shooter, all floating platforms have been removed and as such, the game ends with Gordon falling down through ether for all eternity.

Corporal Shephard called, he wants his role back. :fffuuu:

Read full topic
